full_text: Case 1:20-cr-00330-PAE Document 747 Filed 08/10/22 Page 23 of 228 699 LC2VMAX2 Rocchio - Direct 1 THE COURT: Dr. Rocchio may come forward. 2 LISA ROCCHIO, called as a witness by the Government, having been duly sworn, testified as follows: 3 4 THE COURT: Thank you. You may proceed. 5 MS. POMERANTZ: Thank you, your Honor. 6 7 DIRECT EXAMINATION 8 BY MS. POMERANTZ: 9 Q. Good morning, Dr. Rocchio. 10 A. Good morning. 11 Q. What is your profession? 12 A. I'm a clinical and forensic psychologist. 13 Q. What is clinical psychology? 14 A. It's the study of human behavior and thought, both abnormal and normal. 15 16 Q. And what is forensic psychology? 17 A. Forensic psychology is the application of the science of psychology to a particular legal matter or question. 18 19 Q. Dr. Rocchio, can you please describe your educational background. 20 21 A. I have a bachelor's degree from Emory University, and I have a master's and a Ph.D. from the University of Rhode Island in clinical psychology. 22 23 24 Q. Can you describe for the jury your course work and training in connection with your master's and Ph.D. degrees. 25 SOUTHERN DISTRICT REPORTERS, P.C. (212) 805-0300 DOJ-OGR-00012308
